details.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urge people to vote.
BJP state President B S Yeddyurappa casts first vote at a booth in Shikaripura, Shivamogga.

Saturday will see 600 video teams moving between polling booths and 66 officials checking the video feed constantly for irregularities. Around 12,002 booths have been designated as critical across the state.
Voters can access details of polling station on the phone by sending an SMS to 9731979899 in the following format: KAEPIC <  space  > Your Voter ID number otherwise called EPIC number.

The EC will monitor booths to ensure that there are not more than 1200 voters in any booth which will ensure that the voters are not made to wait for too long. The voting booths will also have facilities like drinking water, toilets, first aid, ORS, disabled friendly measures like wheelchairs  and volunteers to assist the needy.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urge people to vote.

Urging my sisters and brothers of Karnataka to vote in large numbers today. I would particularly like to call upon young voters to vote and enrich this festival of democracy with their participation.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 12, 2018
BJP state President B S Yeddyurappa casts first vote at a booth in Shikaripura, Shivamogga.

#karnatakaassemblyelections2018 BSY visits temple before casting his vote @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/mRVkd07QLN

— Rashmi Belur (@BelurRashmi) May 12, 2018
Poll in Jayanagar constituency countermanded due to the death of BJP candidate B N Vijayakumar.

details.title: Union Minister D V Sadananda Gowda casts his vote in Puttur, stands in queue, refuses to cut the line to vote ahead of others.

details.content:
Union minister @DVSBJP refuses to cut queue. Stands in line to cast vote in Puttur. #KarnatakaElections2018 @NewIndianXpress @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/SLpko3552t

— Anusha Ravi (@anusharavi10) May 12, 2018

In Mangaluru, smartphones and social media keep the youth busy while they wait for their turn to cast their vote. The Chunavana app which provides polling booth details and navigation sees over 50,000 downloads on Google store.
Slight delay due to technical problems when starting the EVM in Benson town, Bengaluru.
99-year-old woman Ningamma casts her vote in Rajajinagar in Bengaluru. She was allowed to vote first while others were in queue.
First voter R Anjanappa, who waited since 6.30 pm got to cast his vote at 7.15 pm. He comes out triumphantly saying he voted for BJP though he knows it will not win in this ward.

@avinbhat The first voter R Anjanappa coming out of the booth at St J G Margaret High School in Benson Town, which falls under Shivaji Nagaraj constituency. Other early birds wait for their turn. pic.twitter.com/10L47zmRyj

— Lolita (@Lolita_TNIE) May 12, 2018

details.title: First time voter Sri Lakshmi from Hubbali-Dharwad central constituency managed to be first in line to vote

details.content: Polling delayed at booth no.111 in #Hoskote due to EVM malfunctioning.Hoskote in Bangalore Rural district is the 178th constituency out of the 224 constituencies that have gone to polls. It usually witnesses the highest voter turnout every elections.

Strict security surrounds polling booths in Bengaluru. The police and security forces are strictly not allowing people to stand around, park their vehicles or loiter near polling stations in several areas including Shantinagar constituency.
Voting yet to begin at Sampige Siddeshwara HPS booth in Chitradurga city due to fault in EVM and VVPAT.

details.title: Karnataka food and civil supplies minister U T Khader casts his vote
details.content:
Namaste! Come on Karnataka
Wake up & make a difference. Mangaluru Voters Kindly https://t.co/GowHnssttV your mark on history! Go and vote!! #KarnatakaElections2018 #CongressForNavaKarnataka #CongressMathomme #NavaKarnatakaNirmana @RahulGandhi @siddaramaiah pic.twitter.com/4E0LGtqaFi

— UT Khadér (@utkhader) May 12, 2018
Former Railways Minister KH Muniyappa's daughter and INC candidate Roopa Kala Seshidhar cast her vote early in the morning at Bethamangala in Kolar Gold Fields.

Labourers from Badami not to be seen in Udupi today as they are in good numbers here toiling hard as construction workers. It is said both the national parties arranged buses for them to go back to Badami to vote as it is a  battleground this time.

Hubballi Votes: Voting begins in Hubballi where voters queued up booths since morning 6.30 - D Hemanth @anusharavi10 @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/BvvlUEbON9

— Amit Upadhye (@Amitsen_TNIE) May 12, 2018

Almost 5 crore voters are exercising their voting rights in what may be one of the most closely watched elections across India in the recent past.

details.title: Quick guide for first-time voters
details.content: If you are a first-time voter or need a quick revision on how to go about the voting process, here is a quick guide.

Voters were denied access to the polling booth to cast their vote in Government High School, Kukkikatte, Udupi because of a problem with the EVM. 200 people returned demanding extension of timing for voting.

Raichur sees low voter turnout in the morning. According to Information Department, polling is progressing at a snail's pace across Raichur district on Saturday.

EVM and VVPAT machines being carried through a boat to Kuruvakurda and Kuruvakula polling stations in Raichur district on May 11, which are located on the island @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/1nMclkchhL

— Shreyas H S (@ShreyasHS3) May 12, 2018

details.title: Techie flies down from Malaysia to cast vote in Basavanagudi
Techie flies down from Malaysia to cast vote in Basavanagudi
details.content: READ FULL REPORT HERE
Five per cent voting recorded at polling booth NO 240 of Shahabad polling booth belonging to Gulbarga-Rural constituency.
Badami JD(S) candidate Hanamantha Mavinamarad was the first to cast vote in his polling station. Badami will witness a tough fight as Chief Minister Siddaramaiah goes up against BJP's Sriramulu.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi welcomes first time voters in Karnataka.
details.content:
Congress President took to twitter and urged people to cast votes in huge numbers. Gandhihad undertaken a long tour of the state over the past two months.

ಮತದಾರರು ತಮ್ಮ ಹಕ್ಕನ್ನು ತಪ್ಪದೇ ಚಲಾಯಿಸುವುದೇ ಕ್ರಿಯಾತ್ಮಕ ಪ್ರಜಾಪ್ರಭುತ್ವದ ಸಂಕೇತ. ನಾನು ಕರ್ನಾಟಕದಲ್ಲಿ ಮೊದಲ ಬಾರಿ ಮತ ಚಲಾಯಿಸುವ ನನ್ನೆಲ್ಲಾ ಯುವ ಸ್ನೇಹಿತರನ್ನು ಸ್ವಾಗತಿಸುತ್ತೇನೆ.

ಕರ್ನಾಟಕದ ಜನತೆ ಹೆಚ್ಚಿನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಜಾಪ್ರಭುತ್ವದ ಅತೀದೊಡ್ಡ ಹಬ್ಬವನ್ನು ಸಂಭ್ರಮದಿಂದ ಆಚರಿಸಿ ಯಶಸ್ವಿಗೊಳಿಸುವಂತೆ ಕೋರಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತೇನೆ.

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) May 12, 2018

details.title: Pink Polling station only for women in Kolar
JD(S) state chief H D Kumaraswamy has breakfast with Adichunchanagiri mutt seer Nirmalananda swamiji on polling day

details.content: G T Devegowda- JD(S) candidate contesting against Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in Chamundeshwari casts his vote
A faulty Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) machine at booth number 108 has stalled voting in Hubli. The machine is being replaced, and voting is yet to resume at the booth.

"I am for development. If anyone wants development, they will vote for me. My victory is confirmed. I call upon all voters to exercise their votes and not waste them," Laxmi Hebbalkar, Congress candidate from Belagavi Rural

details.title: Bus services disrupted on polling day, passengers stranded across the state
details.content: Thousands of commuters were left stranded in parts of Karnataka with a skeletal fleet of government buses plying on roads. With the Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation deploying 1,493 buses and the Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation sparing 4,000 buses for elections, passengers were left stranded at bus terminals across Bengaluru especially.

details.title: Four persons arrested in Kolar for poll code violation
details.content: Four persons have been arrested for being in possession of 190 nose rings allegedly meant for distribution among voters. A team of Kolar police led by DySP Javeed Inamdar intercepted the accused Kolar outskirts. The nose rings were to be distributed purportedly to gain votes in favour of Congress candidate Jameer Basha. Kolar rural police have initiated probe into the matter.

details.title: Four persons arrested in Kolar for poll code violation
details.content: Four persons have been arrested for possessing 190 nose rings allegedly meant for distributing to voters purportedly to gain votes in favour of Congress candidate Jameer Basha. A team led by DySP Javeed Inamdar intercepted the four persons on the Kolar outskirts. Kolar rural police have initiated investigations into the matter.

details.title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah thanks supporters
details.content:
Today People of Karnataka are standing in queues to create history & show the nation the way to liberal, progressive, peaceful & compassionate politics & governance.

I thank them for their support & wish them well. https://t.co/XC662rENDI

— Siddaramaiah (@siddaramaiah) May 12, 2018

details.title: Royal scion Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar casts his vote
Viola Fernandes arrives to cast ballot in her wedding gown at Bondel of Mangaluru.

details.content: BJP's candidate for Molakalmuru and Badami, B Sriramulu performs 'Gau pooja' on polling day in Ballari. BJP's tallest ST leader Sriramulu is in a contest with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in hot seat Badami.
Former Prime Minister H D Devegowda casts his vote.
Technical glitches found in seven EVMs in Shivajinagar constituency, Bengaluru. Sitting MLA Roshan Baig is in a contest with BJP's Katta Subramanya Naidu in the seat.
Poornima a differently-abled young voter exercises her franchise for the first time at Hiresave polling station in Hassan district
Priyank Kharge, Karnataka's IT-BT and Tourism minister casts his vote at Gundgurti village of Chittapur constituency.

details.title: Election officials seize Rs 8.90 lakh being distributed to voters at Challakere
details.content: The Flying squad team of the ECI functioning at Nannivala village of the taluk on Friday at 10.30 PM seized cash to the tune of Rs 8.90 lakh from two persons who were distributing it to the voters. READ FULL REPORT
EVM malfunction forces voters to wait for hours in a queue at Buddani village of Jamhakandi, Bagalkot.
A differently-abled voter arrives at a polling station at Gandhinagar in Bengaluru with help.
BJP MP Pralhad Joshi casts his vote with wife and daughters.
Till 9:15 AM on polling day, around 10.6% of the total 5.06 crore registered voters had shown up to cast their vote, an alert by the Election Commission says.
Ten percent voting recorded in the first 2 hours of voting in Gulbarga--Rural and Jewargi constituencies of Kalaburagi district.

details.title: Voters argue with officials over stalled voting at Numperumal booth
details.content: Voting suspended for a brief period in booth number 180 Numperumal booth (KGF Constituency) following technical problem in EVM. The voters who were standing in the queue argued with the polling staff. In the melee officials exchanged the EVM and again voting commenced.

Every Vote Counts
93-year old Gangavva Halepete from Hubballi casts her vote at Bhavani Nagar - D Hemanth @anusharavi10 @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/vODQV6ixgh

— Amit Upadhye (@Amitsen_TNIE) May 12, 2018

The presiding officer at No 111 Sampige Siddeshwara Higher Primary School was changed for the slow progress of voting in the booth.
CLICK HERE to read full story.
According to Chitradurga district election authorities two machines each at Holalkere, Chitradurga and one each machines at Challakere and Hosadurga were found fault.

Former Prime Minister H. D. Deve Gowda casts his vote at polling booth no.244 in Holenarasipura town in Hassan district #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/hfxsJ2v2sC

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018
Former India cricketer and coach Anil Kumble waits at a polling booth to cast vote with family in Bengaluru.

Minister of State for Tourism Priyank Kharge exercised his franchise from Gundgurti village of Chittapur constituency. As per the inputs of Election officials, two percent votes have been recorded in Chittapur constituency.

492 voters of rural Gudibande refuse to turn up to cast their vote since polling station is 3 kms away from village. Villagers raise slogans against political parties for failing to develop the village that comes under Bagepalli assembly segment of Chikballapur district.
A gram panchayat office, where a pink polling booth is located, has been painted all pink at Yamkanmardi, Belagavi district.
Six constituencies of Uttara Kannada district registered a voter turnout of 7.73 percent till 9 AM.
Members from Beggars Rehabilitation Centre at Pachachanadi, Mangaluru leave their home to cast votes.
Voter turnouts in Udupi constituencies (Till 9 AM): Byndoor registers 6.43%, Kundapura 9.96%,  Udupi 8.65%,  Kaup 10.41%,  Karkala 11.15%

A security personnel helping 86-year-old Joman Rama Naik to exercise his franchise at Majali near #Karwar @avinbhat @anusharavi10 pic.twitter.com/m0Nzw90o4g

details.title: Transgender activist Akkai Padmashali casts her vote in Bengaluru

details.content: "We are confident. BJP will not win more than 60-70 seats maximum, forget getting 150. They are just dreaming of forming the Government," Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge tells ANI.

details.title: First time voters show up in full force
details.content:
First time voters, almost 15 lakh in number in the state elections, will play an important role in the entire poll process. On Saturday, first time voters came out in full force to ensure that their vote was recorded. With most of them undecided on whom to vote for, many said that they simply followed in their family's footsteps. Around 3% of the total voters this elections are first time voters.

Below a first time voter shows her ink mark at Vidyapeta Basavanagudi in Bengaluru.

details.title: EVM's malfunctioning at RMV II stage in Bengaluru: Congress leader Brijesh Kalappa
details.content:
There are 5 booths opposite my Parent's apartment at RMV II Stage, Bengaluru. In the 2nd booth, any button pressed registers a vote ONLY to kiwi mele Kamala i.e Kamal ke phool. Angry voters are returning without casting their vote.

— Brijesh Kalappa (@brijeshkalappa) May 12, 2018

Polling has been suspended in Uthukula village booth number 40 (Bangarpet assembly segment) due to technical problem EVM polling stopped so far 125 voters franchised their votes total voters 1029. Sector officers likely to exchange the EVM

Congress candidate and MLA Feroz Sait had been to Vishveshwariah Nagar in Belagavi north constituency to cast vote,  but did not find his name in the list there.  He was sent to KGID office polling booth where his name was in the list. Though the officials went to receive him,  he declined to break the queue and stood in line to vote.
MLA Govind Karjol cast his vote at Mudhol constituency. It is the only reserved segment in the district.
K R Nagar Independent candidate Hosahalli Venkatesh who was brutally assaulted, arrived in an ambulance to cast his vote.

#KarnatakaElections2018 100 year old Ahmed mankaari at belagavi pic.twitter.com/hTyKkL78su

— Ashwini M Sripad (@AshwiniMS_TNIE) May 12, 2018

Police observer for Kalaburagi district appointed by Election Commission Ashutosh Roy says polling is peaceful in entire district. He was speaking with press persons at a polling booth of Fartabad village of Afzalpur constituency.
Govindrajnagar in BBMP limits registers highest voting percentage across state with 30% turnout by 9:30 AM. Lowest is Chitradurga with just 8% turnout.

details.title: 11 per cent voter turnout reported till 9 am
details.content:
Election authorities said "moderate to brisk" voting has been witnessed in 222 out of 224 seats where polling began at 7 am.

READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: BJP will not win more than 60-70 seats maximum: Kharge
details.content: "We are confident. BJP will not win more than 60-70 seats maximum, forget getting 150. They are just dreaming of forming the Government", says senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge.

details.title: 24 per cent voter turnout recorded till 11 am
details.content: 24 per cent voter turnout recorded till 11 am. (ANI)

details.title: Bengaluru witnesses traffic jams as polling heats up
details.content: With voter turnout increasing as the day progresses, several parts of Old Bengaluru witnessed traffic jams on Saturday morning. Snarls were reported from Gandhinagar, Chikpete, Chamarajpete, Azadnagar, Malleshwaram and other areas. Strict security were in place as people were asked to not park their vehicles next to the polling stations.

Locals of Hogarthi village in Bailhongal taluk have boycotted elections, urging the government to immediately arrest the accused in connection to a recent murder of a pregnant woman. The deceased identified as Geeta was allegedly murdered by her husband Suresh and his parents at Hunshikatti in Kittur taluk on May 6. Police have arrested Suresh and not his parents. Villagers demand to arrest his parents too, only after which they will cast their votes.

Tension prevailed outside a polling booth in RPC layout, Hampinagara in Vijay Nagar in the city where workers of two major parties clashed. The workers started arguing and even started beating each other. Police rushed to the spot and some people were detained.
Voters of Tondkal village of Gulbarga Rural constituency boycott poll for lack of good road to the village.
Election commission officials erase lotus picture drawn in Ghantikeri near a polling station in Hubballi Dharwad East constituency. Residents and official engage in wordy duel.

A good number of transgender woman exercised their franchise at Milagres school in Mangaluru South constituency @anusharavi10 @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/BVZ4JYCrYB

— Arockiaraj Johnbosco (@ArockiarajNIE) May 12, 2018

details.title: Voting in Hebbal suspended
details.content: Voting at booth number 158/1 in RMV II stage in Hebbal suspended after voters alleged that their votes were being cast for one political party candidate irrespective of who they voted for. "People raised concerns when they realised that their votes were going to the BJP. The police was called in and polling was stalled for a brief time. My vote is in the same booth too," Brijesh Kalappa, spokersperson, Congress told Express. 49 people had voted out of a total of 1444 registered voters and every alternate vote was going to a particular party, the ECI officials said. A report would be sent on the matter to the Election Commission and re-polling at the booth is likely to happen.
Ballari records 18.5 percent so far. Kampli 24.87, siraguppa records second highest 24.50. Kudalgi records lowest with just six per cent so far.

Ballari records 18.5 percent so far. Kampli 24.87, Siraguppa records second highest 24.50.

Kudalgi records lowest with just six per cent turn out so far.

details.title: Police resort to mild Lathi charge in Raichur
details.content: Police were forced to resort to mild Lathi charge at Arab Maula in Raichur after commotion broke out between Congress candidate for Raichur urban, Syed Yasin's son, Sohail and an independent candidate Masum. Sohail was near a polling booth urging voters to cast their vote for his father to which the independent candidate objected leading to an altercation.

With wheelchairs provided by the election commission in short supply, several senior citizens had to wait a long time to cast their votes. In some cases, they took matters into their own hands and proceed to vote without waiting for a chair.

I have been visiting villages in the constituency for last 1 & half years. Election campaigning didn't feel any different. Wherever I went, people expressed confidence in Congress govt: Dr Yatheendra, Congress candidate from Varuna constituency & son of Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah to ANI

details.title: Voting heats up!
details.content: A security personnel quenches his thirst while at poll duty. (Express photo by D Hemanth)

Senior Congress leader and former union minister B Janardhan Poojary casting his vote with the help of an assistant at a booth in Bantwal constituency. He had queued up at 6.45 am for voting @anusharavi10 @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/4XmnzacpBs

— vincent dsouza (@vinndz_TNIE) May 12, 2018

details.title: 111-year-old Swamiji who never missed a poll since India's Independence sets a record in Tumakuru
details.content:
The walking god ('nadedavuva 'devaru') 111-year-old Sri Shivakumara Swamiji of famous Siddaganga Mutt has cast his vote in almost all the elections held after India's independence from gram panchayath polls to the Lok Sabha polls without a miss. [FULL REPORT]

SETTING AN EXAMPLE: Centenarian Sri Shivakumara Swamiji just before casting his vote puts his signature at a polling station at Siddaganga Mutt in Tumakuru rural assembly segment on Saturday.

details.title: Confident of victory: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
details.content: Speaking to reporters at Mysuru's Varuna, Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah expressly said that "there is no Modi wave in the state." "We are very very confident that Congress party will come back to power with complete majority," he said.

details.title: BSY is mentally disturbed: Siddaramaiah
details.content:
#WATCH: As voting in #Karnataka continues, CM Siddaramaiah says, 'Yeddyurappa is mentally disturbed. Congress will get more than 120 seats. I am very confident.' #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/yE6isfZcYq

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018

Dharwad: BJP workers staged protest outside Booth No. 58 in Karadigudda, alleging that polling staff at the booth were asking people to vote for Congress candidate Vinay Kulkarni, reports news agency ANI. EC officials present at the spot.

Right before her wedding, a bride casts her vote at polling booth number. 131 in Madikeri. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/UsoxftlFDS

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018

The BJP is genuinely in contention only in 150 of Karnataka’s 224 seats. This is the reason behind the PM’s campaign strategy, writes TNIE's political editor Santwana Bhattacharya

READ HERE: Between Dharma, Yuddha and WiFI

details.title: Congress: PM Modi prayed at Nepal temples to 'influence voters'
details.content: Speaking to ANI earlier in the day, Congress leader Ashok Gehlot said, "As there is model code of conduct in Karnataka, PM Modi planned to pray at temples in Nepal instead, just to influence voters. This is not a good trend for democracy. Why did he only choose today as the day?"
Sri Sri Ravishankar casts his vote at a polling booth in Kanakapura.

details.title: First time voters find help online
Congress, BJP workers clash
details.content:
Bengaluru: Clashes broke out b/w Congress & BJP workers outside a polling booth in Hampi Nagar,allegedly after the former thrashed a BJP corporator. Ravindra, Vijayanagar BJP candidate says, 'our corporator Anand was attacked but police isn't taking any action' #KarnatakaElection pic.twitter.com/SuXFNlI62d

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018

details.title: Clashes broke out between Congress and BJP workers in Bengaluru
details.content: Clashes broke out between Congress and BJP workers outside a polling booth in Bengaluru's Hampi Nagar, allegedly after the former thrashed a BJP corporator. Ravindra, Vijayanagar BJP candidate alleges that their corporator Anand was attacked but police wa't taking any action. (ANI)
Karnataka registers overall voter turnout of 37 per cent till 1 PM.
CM Siddaramaiah and his son Dr Yathindra cast their votes at Varuna constituency on Saturday. (Udayshankara S | EPS)

ANI reports: Former Karnataka Lokayukta Justice Santosh Hegde casts his vote at a polling booth in Bengaluru. Hegde says, 'Over the years, I feel that malpractices have increased. Distribution of sarees, alcohol, dhotis and cookers have come out in open. It is not a good sign in democracy.'
Chief Minister Siddaramaiah casts his vote in Chamundeshwari. He is contesting from Chamundeshwari and Badami constituencies, reoprts ANI.

Dakshina Kannada registered 46 per cent votes till 1 PM

Belthangadi - 52
Moodbidre -43
North -48
South- 39
Ullala - 47
Bantwal -53
Puttur -51
Sulllia - 43
(All figures are in percentage)
Former Foreign Minister and BJP leader SM Krishna casts his vote in a polling booth in Bengaluru.

#WATCH Groom Mallikarjun Gamangatti and bride Nikhita Jodi arrived at polling booth 191-A in Dharwad to cast their vote #KarnatakaElection2018 pic.twitter.com/AeTyf1mgcH

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018

details.title: We're not worried: Siddaramaiah
details.content: This Amit Shah is like a comedy show and Narendra Modi's image has drastically declined, his speeches are completely hollow and have made no impact on the voters of Karnataka. Therefore we are not worried: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah to ANI
52.4 per cent voter turnout recorded till 3 pm, reports ANI.

Voting live: Two persons who cast their votes for Kolar BJP candidate Om Sakthi Chalapathy and JDs candidate K.Srinivasa Gowda recorded their voting secretly in the polling booths and aired it through Whatsapp. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/kzrYkqgBEd

— Avinash Bhat (@avinbhat) May 12, 2018

details.title: JD(S) candidate campaigns outside polling booth
details.content: Active canvassing by JD (Secular) candidate P Ramesh outside polling station in CV Raman Nagar. He tells voters as they enter, "Press number 2".

At Upparapalike Government school, the voter turnout is roughly 55pc in the two polling stations. This booth has 34 endosulfan victim voters, half of who have turned up till noon. Wheelchair facility, permanent ramp installation and a jeep facility for the victims are in place. Endosulfan victims are allowed first in the queue.

Revathi, a resident of Telagodu in Belur constituency, aged 51 died of cardiac arrest after casting her vote in polling station 107 in Gendehalli. According to the police, she collapsed from the motorcycle on the way to her residence from the polling station.

details.title: Irate mob attacks Congress' BP Manjegowda
details.content: Tension prevailed in and around Parasanahalli follwing a mob attack on the vehicle in which the Congress candidate BP Manjegowda of Holenarasipur assembly constituency was travelling. The windshield of his the car was damaged with angry crowd abusing the candidate. A section of youth said to be the supporters of JD (S) also tried to manhandle Manjegowda who later filed a complaint against the former. Additional forces rushed to the village to quell the protesters.

details.title: High temperature hits voter turnout in Kalaburagi
details.content:
43-degree Celsius temperature in Kalaburgi affects the voter turn out. Locals say, 'there was a rush at the booths in the morning, but now there is hardly any crowd at the booths as the temperature is quite high. Right now, it is more than 40 degrees.' #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/y4YAg9AZFM

— ANI (@ANI) May 12, 2018
Water resources minister of Karnataka M B Patil casts his vote in Babaleshwar.
A majority of the 3500 residents of Chittapur taluk's Tarkaspet village in Kalburagi district are boycotting the elections over their demand for Gram Panchayat headquarters for their village.

details.title: Rains hit voters turnout in Hubbali, Dharwad
details.content: With heavy rains lashing parts of Hubballi and Dharwad final phase of voting is likely to get affected. Voter turnout may also get hit if rains hit Bengaluru this evening.

details.title: No extension of poll timing: EC
details.content: Election Commission officials have said that there is no extension of the poll timing as of now and the voting will conclude at 6 PM. People queued up outside polling stations before 6 will be allowed to vote.

details.title: Voter turnout till 3 pm
details.content: While Uttara Kannada registers 56.98 per cent, Dharwad sees 50.54 per cent.

details.title: Muslim woman stopped at Belagavi polling booth, asked to remove burkha
details.content: A Muslim woman was stopped from voting after she refused to remove the veil of her burkha for identification at Karnataka's Belagavi, reports ANI. She was, however, allowed entry after a female official verified her identity. [READ FULL REPORT]

Heavy crowd witnessed in some polling booths in Hubballi-Dharwad Central constituency. There are around 100 voters are standing in queue in booth number 27 in HD Central constituency Gopankoppa @avinbhat @anusharavi10

— Kishan Rajput (@Kishanr_TNIE) May 12, 2018
Karnataka registers 64 per cent voter turnout till 5 PM.
Re-polling will take place in a polling station in Lottegollahalli, Hebbal after voting was stopped due to malfunctioning of a ballot unit.
Total of 164 polling units, 157 control units and 470 VVPATs malfunctioned across state stalling voting process. Voting proceeded after units were replaced

67% voters turned out in Vijayapura district till 5pm. In the last assembly elections the district reported 67.34% voting but this year after the ECI extended the poll timing for another hour, they are expecting more than 75% turnout.

Senior voters at Sirangala were seen checking their BP in 108 ambulance vehicle after casting their votes. #KarnatakaElection2018 #Kodagu @anusharavi10 @vinndz_TNIE @avinbhat pic.twitter.com/2SSVC8fOkc

— Prajna G R (@prajna_gr) May 12, 2018
Schedule for polling closes for Karnataka Elections 2018. However, those waiting at polling booths will be allowed to vote. 64.35 % voter turnout registered till 5 PM

Tension prevailed after clashes broke between two groups at Gokak on Saturday evening. According to sources,  the supporters of Congress candidate Ramesh Jarkiholi clashed with supporters of BJP candidate Ashok Pujari. The BSF force has rushed to the spot to control the situation.

details.title: District-wise polling percentages
details.content:
District-wise polling percentages for #KarnatakaElections2018 till 5 PM. 64% in total. Ramanagara and chikkaballapur register 76% voter turnout. Bengaluru north n south lowest with 47% @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/6ywvDlZHv7

— Anusha Ravi (@anusharavi10) May 12, 2018
The last person to vote on Karnakata Elections 2018 at Mount Carmel Collage, Vasanthnagar Bengaluru comes out smiling as polling comes to an end. | Pushkar V

details.title: Congress to emerge as single largest party: Pre-poll survey
details.content: Pre-poll survey conducted by Peoples Pulse, a political research organization predicted a hung assembly in the state with Congress emerging as a single largest party. [FULL REPORT]
Uttara Kannada Due to EVM problem, voting stopped at polling station No 92 in Hegde village of Kumta taluk. Nearly 400 people are waiting in queue.

details.title: Polling in Hebbal booth held void
details.content: Election Commission holds polling in one of the booths in Hebbal Void. Now, repolling will be held on 14 May, Monday.

Voting in one polling station of Hebbal constituency deemed 'void' by ECI. Fresh polls to be held on May 14 between 7AM and 6PM. @brijeshkalappa @NewIndianXpress #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/CArvdHnWC6

— Anusha Ravi (@anusharavi10) May 12, 2018

details.title: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath exudes confidence of a BJP victory in Karnataka
details.content: Talking to media persons, Adityanath said the BJP will form the next government in Karnataka "with full majority". People there "were fed up of the divisive, communal politics of the Congress" and had decided to "punish it" by voting against it, he added.
Total turnout figure received so far is 70%: Election Commission
We are very confident that we are going to form the govt again. There is a strong wave in favor of Congress: Congress leader KC Venugopal to ANI
